author: Staff Reporter
text:
Additional District Judge II M. Ravindran on Thursday sentenced two youth to undergo life imprisonment for murdering a 38-year-old woman in 2013.

Shanthi of Alamarakadu in Meyyanur was running a beauty parlor in the same area. On March 26, 2013, she was found murdered with stab injuries, in her house.

Also, 5.5 sovereign gold jewellery was missing from the house. The Pallapatti police registered a case.

Jewellery

Inquiries revealed that Vijay alias Vijayakumar (24) and Murali (23) had murdered her and took away the jewellery.

The police said that Shanthi was involved in flesh trade and a dispute broke over money and the two committed the crime.

Fine

The judge sentenced the two to undergo life imprisonment besides imposing a fine of Rs. 10,000 each on them. They were lodged at Salem Central Prison.
title: Two get life term for murder
